items.headline: TSMC’s advanced packaging capacity fully booked by major AI chip customers through next year
items.summary: TrendForce reported TSMC’s CoWoS/SoIC advanced-packaging capacity is fully booked by major AI chip customers, affecting multiple GPU/accelerator suppliers and cloud buyers. citeturn3search1

items.headline: TSMC fully booked on advanced packaging until 2025, TrendForce/EDN coverage
items.summary: Coverage summarised that TSMC’s advanced-packaging orderbook is constrained, calling out potential crowding effects on HBM and multi-customer allocation issues. citeturn3search4

items.headline: TSMC’s advanced packaging booked for two years, industry commentary
items.summary: TechNode reported Taiwanese media saying CoWoS/SoIC capacity is reserved by large GPU/HPC customers, a sector-wide supply constraint for AI accelerators. citeturn11search9

items.headline: Reddit: TSMC’s CoWoS capacity reportedly booked by Nvidia and AMD (community thread)
items.summary: Community discussion picked up TrendForce reporting that TSMC’s advanced-packaging slots are reserved by major GPU/accelerator vendors, debating allocation across peers. citeturn1reddit18

items.headline: Infographic: 'Breaking Down $545 Billion Semiconductor' (sector revenue breakdown shared on Reddit)
items.summary: Viral sector infographic outlining semiconductor revenue segments and supply-chain chokepoints, widely shared by investors and technologists. citeturn0reddit22

items.headline: TSMC April sales jump as AI demand stays strong (social discussion)
items.source: r/stocks (Reddit post summarising TSMC revenue jump)
items.summary: Reddit discussion highlighted TSMC’s strong April sales, reinforcing the industry-wide AI-driven demand narrative for foundry and packaging services. citeturn1reddit20

items.headline: SK Hynix says high-end HBM production largely sold out through 2025
items.summary: SK Hynix announced HBM output for 2024 was sold out and much of 2025 already allocated, tightening memory supply used across AI accelerators. citeturn5search2

items.headline: TSMC advanced-packaging demand heralds growth for packaging suppliers
items.summary: Industry outlets flagged that TSMC’s booking pressure is stimulating equipment and OSAT supplier activity, a multi-company supply-chain story. citeturn3search5

items.headline: HBM supply tightness: coverage noting SK Hynix and Micron commitments
items.summary: Tom’s Hardware summarised vendor remarks that HBM inventories are mostly allocated for 2024–2025, creating cross-company memory supply tightness for AI accelerators. citeturn5search1

window_summary: Industry conversations May 3–10 focused on TSMC advanced-packaging bookings and tight HBM memory allocations constraining AI accelerator supply. citeturn3search1turn5search2
